snippet: Washington’s Alex Ovechkin played only 13 minutes 26 seconds of Game 2 against the Rangers but still ended up the hero at Madison Square Garden.
abstract: Washington Capitals captain Alex Ovechkin plays only 13 minutes 26 seconds of Game 2 against New York Rangers but still ends up the hero in 3-2 victory. (M)ø
lead_paragraph: Alex Ovechkin, the captain and superstar forward of the Washington Capitals, had never played less than 15 minutes in a playoff game before Monday night. Then, in Game 2 of the Eastern Conference semifinals against the Rangers, Ovechkin played 13 minutes 26 seconds and still ended up the hero at Madison Square Garden. Ovechkin scored the deciding goal at 12:33 of the third period on a power play as the Capitals won, 3-2, tying the series at a game apiece.
